bayou.form

Class FormParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.form.FormParser

  • public class FormParser
extends Object
    Parses form data from http requests. See parse(uri) and parse(request).

    See also FormData.parse(uri) and FormData.parse(request) which use this parser with default configuration.

    Config

    A parser can be configured by methods like charset(Charset). These methods return `this` for method chaining. For example 

         FormParser parser = new FormParser()
         .charset(StandardCharsets.US_ASCII)
         .maxFileEntries(3)
         ;

     parser.parse(...);

    A parser can be cached to parse multiple requests concurrently, as long as its configuration is no longer modified. 

         static final FormParser parser = new FormParser().maxFileEntries(0); // disallow file upload

    CSRF Detection

    By default, detectCsrf is enabled. If a request is POST, parse(request) uses the following heuristics to determine that the request is not CSRF.

    • The CSRF token in the form field matches the token in the cookie. See csrfTokenName(String) and CsrfToken.
    • The "Origin" request header matches the "Host" header, e.g. "Origin: http://localhost:8080".
    • The "Referer" request header matches the "Host" header, e.g. "Referer: http://localhost:8080/show".

    Otherwise, parse(request) fails with CsrfException. Note that false detection is possible - the request is suspected as CSRF while in reality it is legitimate. See Generate a response for a CsrfException

    • Constructor Detail

      • FormParser

        public FormParser()
        Create a parser with default settings.

        Use methods like charset(Charset) to configure the parser after construction.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public FormData parse(CharSequence uri)
               throws ParseException,
                      OverLimitException
        Parse the URI for form data.

        The query component of the URI is expected to be "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".

        This method can be used for any request URI, regardless of the request method.

        Throws:
        ParseException - the query component of the URI is not valid "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".
        OverLimitException - a conf limit is exceeded, for example "maxParamEntries"

      • parse

        public Async<FormData> parse(HttpRequest request)
        Parse the request for POST form data.

        If the request method is POST, and the Content-Type is "multipart/form-data" or "application/x-www-form-urlencoded", the request body is parsed accordingly.

        This is an Async action. The action may fail with the following exceptions:

        • ParseException - the request does not contain valid POST form data
        • OverLimitException - a conf limit is exceeded, for example "maxParamEntries"
        • CsrfException - the request is suspected to be CSRF
        • Exception - other errors, e.g. network error while reading request body
